value.title: Introduction to Power BI Embedded | Power BI Embedded Step by Step Series | Part 1
value.excerpt: Welcome to Power BI Embedded Step by Step series. Myself Dhruvin Shah. The entire series is dedicated to the Intermediate level of Power BI folks. The series covers step by step guide to embed the Power BI report in any third-party custom application or SaaS application. During this video, we will learn

value.title: Make a Table Visualization to Display All Observations from Data Source in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this session, I’m demonstrating how we can show all the records even if it is the same as the Power BI table. We all know that the Power BI table visual automatically removes the duplicate rows from end-users in the table. But sometimes we need to show the end-users all the values from the data source

value.title: New way to compare Date and DateTime Value in Power BI - August 2021 Feature Summary
value.excerpt: Welcome to one more new update from Power BI Desktop. Sometimes we need to compare date or DateTime value in our DAX expression. At that time, we are using Date() function and Time() function. Now, there's one more easy way to compare Date and Time value in Power BI which is using "dt" keyword before

value.title: Next-Generation Power BI Buttons
value.excerpt: (September 2021 Power BI Desktop Feature Summary) | NEW FORMATTING OPTIONS FOR POWER BI BUTTONS  Welcome to one more Power BI Desktop Update from September 2021. value.title: Power BI DAX for Beginners: AVERAGE, AVERAGEA, AVERAGEX
value.excerpt: Welcome to the complete Power BI DAX Beginner Series. During this session, we will discuss the AVERAGE function in DAX. AVERAGE function in Power BI DAX has lots of variations. During this session, we will cover AVERAGE, AVERAGEA, AVERAGEX. So, Let's get started!  The Episode covers the following information:

value.title: Power BI Tip - Hide Filter Pane From the Published Version of Power BI Report
value.excerpt: In this vlog we will learn about how we can hide the Filter Pane from the published version of the Power BI report. Sometimes there are situations in which we have set our Visual, Page or Report level filter as a part of development logic and we wish that end user should not able to change those values.

value.title: Power BI Tip - Stop Visual Interactions at Report Level in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this vlog we will learn about how we can stop the interaction between the visualization. In Power BI, whenever we select any visual data point, it filters other visuals based on the selected data point. Sometimes there is a requirement, where we don’t need the filtering functionality on selected data

value.title: Quickly create Power BI Report from SharePoint List  or Microsoft List
value.excerpt: We will learn how to quickly create our Power BI Report directly from SharePoint List or Microsoft Lists during this session. This is the first integration experience with Power BI. This experience empowers SharePoint list and Microsoft List users to easily explore their list data with just a few clicks.

value.title: Relative Time Slicer in Power BI

With Relative Time Slicer, we can filter data based on the time.  Sometimes there are situations, where we need to filter

value.title: Search bar in Power BI Desktop
